snippet: A former traffic officer’s 30-year tradition of dancing while directing shopping season traffic ended when city officials did not hire him, after he became the subject of controversy.
abstract: City officials decide to end 30-year tradition in which former East Providence traffic officer Tony Lepore dances while directing shopping season traffic in Rhode Island; decision follows Lepore's organization of protests against Black Lives Matter movement outside Dunkin Donuts in October.
lead_paragraph: A former traffic officer’s 30-year tradition of dancing while directing shopping season traffic ended when city officials did not hire him, after he became the subject of controversy.

headline.main: Rhode Island: Tradition Ends After Protests
headline.print_headline: Rhode Island: Tradition Ends After Protests
